title: Katty Kay: The danger of wishful Western thinking
description: With Russia still a powerful force, wide-eyed realism is what Ukraine needs from the US and Europe.

title: War in Ukraine: Change of emphasis or admission of failure by Moscow?
description: Moscow now says the main aim is to "liberate" eastern Ukraine - a change of emphasis or more?

title: Bale hits back at Spanish media over 'parasite' criticism
description: Wales forward Gareth Bale has hit out at Spanish newspaper Marca for a column which described him as a "parasite".

title: Next stop Kyiv - the battle on the capital's outskirts
description: In Irpin, only a few civilians remain as volunteers bolster defences a few miles from Kyiv.

title: On the road to Mariupol, a southern Ukrainian town fears for the worst
description: Residents of a town neighbouring Mariupol ready themselves for Russian missile and rocket attacks.

title: John Lennon's son opens Yoko Ono performance centre in Liverpool
description: Sean Lennon talks about his mother's "great love for Liverpool" as he opens a centre for live music.

title: Leeds teacher tackling poverty by giving 'every head a bed'
description: Charities are calling on the government to do more to address the rising cost of living.

title: Say Yes To Tess: Turning a doomed election campaign into a musical
description: Tess Seddon has made a stage show out of standing for parliament for the Yorkshire Party.

title: David Amess killing: Ali Harbi Ali told police 'I done it, I killed an MP'
description: The Old Bailey hears the man accused of killing Sir David Amess told police it was a terrorist attack.

title: EU signs US gas deal to curb reliance on Russia
description: The liquefied natural gas deal with US is part of EU attempts to reduce reliance on Russian energy.

title: UK Covid infections climb by a million in a week
description: Around 4.3 million people - or one in every 16 - are thought to have the virus, compared to 3.3 million the week before.

title: Women's Six Nations: Watch the best tries from the 2021 tournament
description: From mazy runs to outstanding offloads relive the best tries from the 2021 Women's Six Nations.

title: Dawn Sturgess: 'Rigorous' inquiry into Novichok death
description: Dawn Sturgess died after being exposed to the Russian nerve agent Novichok in Wiltshire in 2018.

title: PM backs calls for P&O Ferries boss Peter Hebblethwaite to resign
description: Boris Johnson backs Grant Shapps' call for Peter Hebblethwaite to quit after not consulting on sackings.

title: Bridgerton: Mixed responses from critics to second series
description: The hit Netflix series is described as "less fun" with fewer sex scenes, but also "more dynamic".

title: Broughton and Boehly consortiums make Chelsea shortlist
description: The consortiums involving ex-Liverpool chairman Sir Martin Broughton and Los Angeles Dodgers co-owner Todd Boehly make the shortlist of bidders to buy Chelsea.

title: FA Cup: Liverpool and Manchester City fans to be given 100 free buses for Wembley semi-final
description: The FA is to provide 100 free buses for fans attending the FA Cup semi-final between Liverpool and Manchester City at Wembley.

title: Covid: Wales' mask law to end in shops, but not NHS
description: Despite rising cases, the law to self-isolate if you have Covid will end on Monday.

title: Sir Philip Pullman resigns as Society of Authors president after book row
description: Sir Philip Pullman says he cannot express personal opinions as president of the Society of Authors.

title: Crimean-Congo haemorrhagic fever case found in UK
description: A woman had recently travelled to Central Asia where the tick bite viral disease is endemic.

title: ‘P&O Ferries weren’t just jobs - they were our homes’
description: Former P&O employee John, who was made redundant suddenly, explains his anger with the operator.

title: Ukraine war: The road to safety for Ukraine's cancer children
description: About 200 hospitals worldwide are offering safe cancer treatment for boys like Pavlo and Kyril.

title: Ferrell should have had Oscar nomination for Elf, says Curtis
description: Screenwriter and director Richard Curtis says awards voters often overlook comedy and its actors.

title: Sebastian Vettel: Aston Martin driver ruled out of Saudi Arabia race because of Covid-19
description: Aston Martin's Sebastian Vettel is ruled out of the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix because of Covid-19.

title: Ukraine War: Civilians abducted as Russia tries to assert control
description: The UN has documented almost 40 cases of politicians, journalists and activists being abducted.

title: Manchester Arena attack: Mum wants right to register son’s death
description: Caroline Curry called on the home secretary to "look in her heart" and change an "antiquated" law.

title: Kiko Martinez v Josh Warrington: A look back at their most recent fights
description: A look back at the fights leading up to Josh Warrington's bid to become a two-time world champion when he faces Kiko Martinez on Saturday.

title: Ukraine war: A dangerous escape on the 'Rescue Express'
description: A risky night-time race to safety lies ahead for exhausted families fleeing Kyiv each day.

title: Ukraine: Nato will respond if Russia uses chemical weapons, warns Biden
description: The US president made the comments during an unprecedented day of emergency summits in Brussels.

title: The Papers: Biden's chemical weapon warning and 'Shame on' P&O
description: Rising tensions with Russia and criticism of a ferry firm boss are among a mix of stories in the papers.

title: Spring Statement: Is this really the biggest personal tax cut for 25 years?
description: The Spring Statement cut some taxes but, overall, the government has raised taxes in the past year.

title: Ukraine war: Return to Irpin, the town destroyed in the battle for Kyiv
description: The BBC's Jeremy Bowen returns to Irpin, where Ukrainian forces say they're pushing back Russians.

title: Australia floods: 'We're resilient, but how about helping us?'
description: Locals tell dramatic stories of survival and recovery, but accuse politicians of ignoring them.

title: Michael Bublé: Multi-Grammy winner on Bond themes, romantic gifts and new album
description: An egg poacher, a toaster and the washing up - just some ways Michael Bublé shows his romantic side.

title: Ukraine war: The priest shot at a checkpoint
description: The shooting of a Ukrainian priest by Russian soldiers is being logged as a suspected war crime.

title: 'It's disgusting and they should be ashamed' - Bale silences critics to send Wales to brink of World Cup
description: Written off at Real Madrid, Gareth Bale was Wales' saviour once more against Austria to take his country one step closer to an elusive World Cup.

title: Notts County and the conman: Following your team through a football scam
description: In the summer of 2009 mysterious new owners promised to propel fourth-tier side Notts County to grand success. It was all a big lie.

title: Italy 'destroyed and crushed' after World Cup hopes ended
description: Italy's players and manager struggle to come to terms with one of their most infamous defeats, a loss to North Macedonia which ends their World Cup hopes.
